revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{m|en|ex-}} and {{m|en|Googler}}. ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|informal}} A former [[employee]] of the [[Google]] corporation. #: {{cot|en|Googler|Noogler}} #* '''2007''', ''The Economist'' (volume 384, page 58) #*: Older Googlers with families tend to like it less, because "everybody, even young mums, works seven days a week." Another '''Xoogler''', who held a senior position, says that by trying to create a "Utopia" of untrammelled creativity, Google ended up with "dystopia". #* {{quote-text|en|year=2012|author=Brian Clifton|title=Advanced Web Metrics with Google Analytics|page=205|passage=As a search marketer, '''Xoogler''' (ex-Googler), and now web consultant, I have seen both sides of the “Google fence,” and that has been fascinating.}} [[Category:en:Google]]
